author: NOAH CAPUCILLI-SHATA

text:
What an amazing song. So much emotion, and such a strong driving energy behind it. Where did ACE+ come up with this shit? I can't find any other songs like this... can anyone point me to some similar stuff? 

I'm no music expert, but the constantly rising chord progression during the chorus seems pretty...  unique, and incredibly powerful. I'm having a hard time finding any music that does anything similar.
author: Kevin Stefan

text: +Kevin Stefan I think you might find some of that in a few Porcupine Tree songs (from the In Absentia or Deadwing albums), or The Mars Volta if you're okay with rougher atmospheres. But yeah, it's difficult to find a match.
author: MinorCirrus

text: +Kevin Stefan One reason is that you don't see electric guitars jamming with violins, another thing is the song keeps its intensity with all the strings piano ect
author: Royceごんどうひろし

text: +Kevin Stefan One reason is that you don't see electric guitars jamming with violins, another thing is the song keeps its intensity with all the strings piano ect
author: Royceごんどうひろし

text:
D:You fought beside me at Sword Valley!
- Why did you change sides?
- Why the Mechon?
M: You're as blind as you were then!
- I've wanted you dead for years!
[...] - I wanted to get the Monado so I could be the new hero!
D: Is that it!?
- That's the puerile reason you've killed all those innocent people?
- Ravaged our home!
M: I love this body. The power!
- Dunban, you'll never win!
- Get on your knees and worship me!
D: Never.
- I will strike you down and all that you have become, you wretched fool.
- The Monado will stop you.
- *And then you will know the shame of all that you've done, traitor!
M: Shut your mouth and come on!
author: MythrilMan

text: Indeed, one of the best lines in the game. Although Xenoblade Chronicles is full of great lines (it has an amazing storyline!) this one may be one of my favs.
author: Marc X. Costal

text: +Marc X. Costal The best time I think it played was probably Prison Island, everything really fit there.

author: NovaCascade

text:
The release of the n3DS version better not devalue my Wii copy or I will be PISSED.

The only reason it became so expensive is because ninty underestimated the demand and printed too few for NA release. Oh sure, they wouldnt print more copies but they were perfectly fine rereleasing the game on an updated 3ds version which they also said they never had any plans of making? WELL FUCK YOU NINTENDO!

p.s. why the FUCK is kirby return to dreamland so expensive?
author: bulbinking

text: @bulbinking Huh. Guess I got lucky when my local Gamestop only wanted $55 for it. Money well spent, though. This game goes on forever. :D
author: StraightEdgeAspie

text:
@TH-OH Productions
I found the last copy for 60 bucks.

I also have a copy of phantasy star online 1&2 plus for gamecube (probably my most valuable game)

For collectors like me rereleases are especially infuriating.
author: bulbinking

text: +bulbinking ok
author: Trooper 21

text:
Why does it better if your game was devalued? Shouldn't the hope be that a good game should be spread to everyone who wants it, and therefore shouldn't be overly expensive?
That's the way I see it, at least.
author: Sazzandora11

text:
@Sazzandora11
The only reason I spent so much on the game instead of getting it through other means is because I wanted to support rainfall by showing nintendo people do spend money on "niche" games, and I knew it would retain its value for awhile.
author: bulbinking

text:
@bulbinking Huh. A mix of noble and dickish intentions.
Damn you, nuanced scalpers!
author: Sazzandora11

text: Even now that the Wii version is out on WiiU from the eshop, discs and boxes for Xenoblade Wii are still aggressively sought after by collectors.

text: I love this song and this game's soundtrack.  It is my second favorite soundtrack of all time and the variety of music in this game is a marvel to behold.  As for the game itself, i have played some of it, but not a whole lot.  I hope to get a good chunk of it played some time soon.  I honestly wish that i could play more RPGs, but i just can't section off time to play them for long periods of time.

author: SassMaster9000

text: @SassMaster9000 It's called both, it changes depending on localisation
author: Bainbridge

text: @Bainbridge Hm. This makes me wonder, is it called Confrontation With The Enemy in the European version of Smash Bros too?
author: SassMaster9000

text: @SassMaster9000​ no in Europe It's called engage the enemy
author: Bainbridge

text: @Bainbridge But it's called Engage the Enemy here in America too. Also, I was under the impression that the american release didn't receive any kind of localisations, as everything still has it's British spelling. Is there another localisation that uses English that I'm unaware of?
author: SassMaster9000

text: Just looked it up on the wiki, it seems like it's more of an alternate title than a localisation thing.
author: SassMaster9000

text: @SassMaster9000 ahhh thanks for informing me... strange though
author: Bainbridge

text: @Bainbridge Yeah, usually alternate titles have bigger differences between them, so I see how that would cause some confusion.
